description: Installs WSL and the default Linux distribution.
Updates the WSL kernel to the latest version.
Lists all available Linux distributions online.
Lists installed Linux distributions with additional information.
Sets the default WSL version (1 or 2) for new installations.
Converts a specified Linux distribution to WSL version 1 or 2.
Sets the default Linux distribution for `wsl` command executions.
Runs a specified Linux distribution.
Lists all installed Linux distributions with their WSL version.
Terminates a specified running Linux distribution.
Shuts down all running distributions and the WSL 2 VM.
Unregisters (deletes) a specified Linux distribution.
Executes a specific Linux command directly in WSL.
Displays help for WSL commands and options.
Exports the specified Linux distribution to a tar file.
Imports a Linux distribution from a tar file.
Mounts a disk as a block device without automatically attaching filesystems.
Unmounts and detaches a disk.
Launches the default shell as a specified user.
Runs a specific command as a specified user within a specified distribution.
Lists files and directories in the current directory.
Changes to the specified directory.
Prints the current working directory.
Copies files or directories.
Moves or renames files or directories.
Removes a file.
Creates a new directory.
Removes an empty directory.
Creates a new empty file or updates the timestamp of an existing file.
Displays the contents of a file.
Edits a file using the Nano text editor.
Edits a file using the Vim text editor.
Searches for a pattern in a file.
Finds files by name within a directory.
Changes file permissions.
Changes file ownership.
Creates a symbolic link to a file or directory.
Displays disk usage in a human-readable format.
Displays disk usage of a directory.
Displays a list of running processes.
Displays real-time system resource usage.
Terminates a process by its process ID (PID).
Terminates processes by name.
Starts a specified service.
Stops a specified service.
Restarts a specified service.
Starts a service using systemd.
Stops a service using systemd.
Restarts a service using systemd.
Enables a service to start on boot.
Disables a service from starting on boot.
Displays network interface information.
Sends ICMP echo requests to test connectivity to a host.
Downloads files from the internet.
Transfers data from or to a server.
Copies files over SSH.
Connects to a remote host via SSH.
Creates a compressed tar archive.
Extracts a compressed tar archive.
Creates a zip archive.
Extracts a zip archive.
Shows a list of previously executed commands.
Creates a shortcut for a command.
Displays the system PATH variable.
Sets an environment variable for the current session.
Displays system information.
Shows how long the system has been running.
Displays or sets the system date and time.
Displays a calendar.
Displays the current logged-in user.
Changes the user password.
Displays Linux distribution information.
Shows the manual page for a command.
Updates the package list for APT package manager.
Installs the latest versions of all packages.
Installs a package using APT.
Removes a package using APT.
Searches for a package in the APT repository.
Installs a .deb package.
Removes a package using dpkg.
Lists all iptables firewall rules.
Allows SSH connections through iptables.
Removes an SSH allow rule from iptables.
Mounts a filesystem.
Unmounts a filesystem.
Lists disk partitions.
Formats a device with the ext4 filesystem.
Copies and converts files.
Starts the partition editor.
Lists block devices.
Shows the UUID of all disk partitions.
Checks and repairs a filesystem.
Displays disk usage along with filesystem type.
